title: [Large-scale] CSCL Design Workshop for Cognitive Load Optimization: Application in Large-scale Elementary Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in basic mathematics instruction and ability to utilize digital tools
context.additional_context: Mixed-methods research design where participants experience CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) in real classroom settings. Learners practice managing digital artifacts (assignments, collaboration tools, etc.) using personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: Design three or more artifact flow models in CSCL environments to reduce cognitive load by 20%

Participants will create one CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) design efficiency evaluation portfolio over 1â€“6 months, applying a mixed-methods approach (three quantitative metrics: participation rate, task completion rate, discussion frequency; two qualitative metrics: peer evaluation, self-reflection journal), and achieve an "Excellent" rating in four out of five institutional evaluation rubric items.
Develop a collaborative math project identifying and correcting five error patterns in large classes (30+ students)

resources: Digital collaboration tools (Padlet, Google Workspace, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
